de.hshl.obj.loader.materials

Class Texture

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hshl.obj.meta.Reflective.DataClass
      • de.hshl.obj.loader.materials.Texture

  • public final class Texture
extends Reflective.DataClass
    Contains the path to an image file and options on how to display the image. For more information on MTL Textures, see this website.
    Author:
    Johannes Vollmer
    See Also:
    MTL

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Texture.Channel
      An image channel which can be selected.
      static class  Texture.ReflectionMapType
      The type of the reflection map.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Texture(Resource.Environment environment)
      Create a Texture and specify in which resource directory it will be found.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Double getBoost()
      Apply sharpness to the texture according to this value.
      java.lang.Double getBrightnessMultiplier()
      Multiply this value to all RGB values.
      java.lang.Double getBrightnessOffset()
      Add this value to all RGB values.
      java.lang.Double getBumpMultiplier()
      Multiply this value to all bump maps.

      Use clamping.

      The local relative file name of the texture file.

      Use horizontal blending.
      double[] getPositionOffset()
      Offset the origin of the texture by this value, [x, y].
      Texture.ReflectionMapType getReflectionMapType()
      The type of reflection mapping this texture is set to.
      Resource getResource()
      Returns the Resource (file or jar resource) of this texture file.
      Texture.Channel getScalarChannel()
      Which channel to pick when converting the texture to grayscale.
      double[] getScaleFactor()
      Scale the texture by this value, [x, y].
      java.lang.Long getTextureResolution()
      Smallest power of two which is larger than the actual texture resolution.
      double[] getTurbulence()
      Distort the texture by this value, [x, y], avoiding repeating patterns.
      java.lang.Boolean getVerticalTextureBlending()
      Use vertical blending.

      Returns true if this texture is a reflection map.

      • getEnvironment

        public Resource.Environment getEnvironment()

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String getFileName()
        The local relative file name of the texture file.
        See Also:
        getEnvironment(), getResource()

      • getResource

        public Resource getResource()
        Returns the Resource (file or jar resource) of this texture file. Use Resource.getFilePath() or Resource.open() and give it to your image loading library.

      • setFileName

        public void setFileName(java.lang.String file)
        See Also:

        Returns true if this texture is a reflection map.

        @Nullable
public java.lang.Boolean getHorizontalTextureBlending()

      • getScalarChannel

        @Nullable
public Texture.Channel getScalarChannel()
        Which channel to pick when converting the texture to grayscale. Null if not specified, default should be luminance or matte.

public java.lang.Double getBrightnessOffset()

public java.lang.Long getTextureResolution()
